error.Text: failed to pull and unpack image "docker.io/library/wordpress:latest": failed to copy: httpReadSeeker: failed open: unexpected status code https://registry-1.docker.io/v2/library/wordpress/manifests/sha256:79dd7ea093b253ebbfd49869222534108c90c1e06b7074250e07514a6a0d1454: 429 Too Many Requests - Server message: toomanyrequests: You have reached your pull rate limit. You may increase the limit by authenticating and upgrading: https://www.docker.com/increase-rate-limit

results.details:
Error: The error indicates that the Docker pull rate limit has been exceeded, causing the image pull to fail.

Solution: 
1. Authenticate with Docker: `docker login`.
2. Upgrade your Docker account for higher limits: https://www.docker.com/increase-rate-limit.
3. Use a different image registry if possible.

results.details:
Error: The error indicates that the Docker image pull request was denied due to exceeding the rate limit.

Solution: 
1. Authenticate with Docker using `docker login`.
2. Upgrade your Docker account to increase the pull rate limit.
3. Use a private registry if possible to avoid rate limits.

results.name: default/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-674dc66f7-6mz69], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the expected pod is not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs <pod-name>`.
3. Verify pod readiness probe configuration.
4. Ensure pod dependencies are available.
5. Restart pod if needed.

results.name: default/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-b85f5ff7f-snck2], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service is missing ready endpoints because the pod 'wordpress-b85f5ff7f-snck2' isn't ready, but 1 ready pod is expected.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod details using `kubectl describe pod wordpress-b85f5ff7f-snck2`.
3. Look for readiness probe issues or errors.
4. Fix any configuration or resource issues.
5. Restart the pod if needed.
